comment: fundamental, a primary constitutent element, a foundational element, a word that conveys these principles and is nonetheless ... basic ;; the wording was meticulously reviewed by more than one editor

diff.*:
Line 9: Line 9:  
{{wiktionarypar|love}}
 
{{wiktionarypar|love}}
    −
'''Love''' is a dimension of [[human]] experience that is variously conveyed as a sense of tender [[affection]], an intense [[interpersonal attraction|attraction]], the foundation of [[intimacy]] and good [[interpersonal chemistry]], willing self-sacrifice on behalf of another, and as an [[ineffability|ineffable]] sense of affinity or connection to nature, other living beings, or even that which is unseen. It manifests itself in [[feeling]]s, [[emotion]], [[behavior]], [[thoughts]], [[perception]] and [[Attitude (psychology)|attitude]]. It influences, underlies and defines major patterns in [[interpersonal relationship]]s and [[self (psychology)|self-identification]].
+
'''Love''' is a basic dimension of [[human]] experience that is variously conveyed as a sense of tender [[affection]], an intense [[interpersonal attraction|attraction]], the foundation of [[intimacy]] and good [[interpersonal chemistry]], willing self-sacrifice on behalf of another, and as an [[ineffability|ineffable]] sense of affinity or connection to nature, other living beings, or even that which is unseen. It manifests itself in [[feeling]]s, [[emotion]], [[behavior]], [[thoughts]], [[perception]] and [[Attitude (psychology)|attitude]]. It influences, underlies and defines major patterns in [[interpersonal relationship]]s and [[self (psychology)|self-identification]].
